span.span: Enumerates the elements of a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks C#语言的 `foreach` 语句（`for each` 中C++`For Each` Visual Basic）隐藏了枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 之前， 返回相同的对象。 returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位到集合中的最后一个元素之后， 返回 `false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对 的后续调用也将返回 `false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果对的最后一个调用 返回 `false`，则 未定义。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举器就仍有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举器将失效且不可恢复，并且对 或 的下一次调用引发了 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 不同步 中集合的默认实现。Default implementations of collections in are not synchronized.

summary.span: 获取枚举数当前位置的元素。

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在下列任一情况下，不定义 ： is undefined under any of the following conditions: - 枚举器位于集合的第一个元素之前。The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection. 在创建枚举器之后或在调用 方法之后发生。That happens after an enumerator is created or after the method is called. 在读取 属性的值之前，必须调用 方法，使枚举数前进到集合的第一个元素。The method must be called to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of the property. - 对 的最后一次调用返回了 `false`，它指示集合的末尾，枚举器定位在集合的最后一个元素之后。The last call to returned `false`, which indicates the end of the collection and that the enumerator is positioned after the last element of the collection. - 由于对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），枚举器无效。The enumerator is invalidated due to changes made in the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements. 不移动枚举器的位置，并且在调用 或 之前，对 的连续调用返回相同的对象。 does not move the position of the enumerator, and consecutive calls to return the same object until either or is called.

summary.span: 使枚举数前进到 的下一个元素。

span.span: Advances the enumerator to the next element of the .

returns.span: 如果枚举器已成功前进到下一个元素，则为 ；如果枚举器已通过集合的末尾，则为 。

span.span: if the enumerator was successfully advanced to the next element; if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 创建枚举器后，枚举数将定位在集合中的第一个元素之前，第一次调用 会将枚举数前移到集合的第一个元素。After an enumerator is created, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection, and the first call to advances the enumerator to the first element of the collection. 如果 越过集合的末尾，则枚举器将定位到集合中的最后一个元素之后， 返回 `false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对 的后续调用也将返回 `false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 只要集合保持不变，枚举器就仍有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举器将失效且不可恢复，并且对 的下一次调用会引发 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to throws an .

exception.span: 集合在枚举器创建后被修改。

span.span: The collection was modified after the enumerator was created.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在下列任一情况下，不定义 ： is undefined under any of the following conditions: - 枚举器位于集合的第一个元素之前。The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection. 在创建枚举器之后或在调用 方法之后发生。That happens after an enumerator is created or after the method is called. 在读取 属性的值之前，必须调用 方法，使枚举数前进到集合的第一个元素。The method must be called to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of the property. - 对 的最后一次调用返回了 `false`，它指示集合的末尾，枚举器定位在集合的最后一个元素之后。The last call to returned `false`, which indicates the end of the collection and that the enumerator is positioned after the last element of the collection. - 由于对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），枚举器无效。The enumerator is invalidated due to changes made in the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements. 不移动枚举器的位置，并且在调用 或 之前，对 的连续调用返回相同的对象。 does not move the position of the enumerator, and consecutive calls to return the same object until either or is called.

exception.span: 枚举器位于集合中第一个元素之前或最后一个元素之后。

span.span: The enumerator is positioned before the first element of the collection or after the last element.

This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 只要集合保持不变，枚举器就仍有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合所做的更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举器将失效且不可恢复，并且对 或 的下一次调用引发了 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an .
